website_summaries.verdict: One of the most versatile ice packs you can buy, this works well for smaller lunch boxes or bags.
pros: Users appreciate the uniform cooling, ease of cleaning and storing, and it's versatile enough to fit almost any bag, even smaller ones
It also stands out for freezing quickly
cons: May not keep food cold for long in extremely hot temperatures or for extended periods

customer_reviews.title: Find something better
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with these at all! I'm putting them in a small Rubbermaid cooler to keep drinks cold and they melt within an hour. Two of them are actually leaking, only used for a week and they did nothing to keep anything cool.
customer_reviews.author: Lea S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These work great to keep my lunch cool at work. I work 12 hour shifts so this is important to me.
customer_reviews.author: G. Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected for the size.
customer_reviews.text: Stays cold as expected. I wish it would last longer but it is what it is for the size. I used two in a soft insulated box for food and beverage storage. The two cool packs lasted 5 hours. It was a mixture off having the box in my vehicle and inside an air conditioned building during work hours 6am-11am before the packs where no longer frozen. I will try all four in the box next time.
customer_reviews.author: J-a Bazinet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in Every Way
customer_reviews.text: Perfect in every way -- thin (doesn't take up much space) and effective (stays really cold). I carry a small rectangular-shaped soft-sided lunch box (10" x 8" x 8" made by Peak & Prosper) every day (another Amazon purchase) -- I place one of these in the bottom and a second one on top. My food & beverage both stay perfectly-chilled.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Preschuti

customer_reviews.title: They are thin and they melt down extra fast
customer_reviews.text: I just got these. Tried them in a very well insulated lunch bag and two of them didn't last 2 hours in an average heat day-not 100 degrees, just average. And, likely because they are so very thin. Not recommending this product one iota. They melted into a pool of condensation on the bottom of the lunch bag. Even cheap Walmart ones last twice as long. Back to the drawing board for a product that works.
customer_reviews.author: Yarburger

customer_reviews.title: It's an ice pack, too thin, too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed that these ice packs are so thin. They seem very overpriced for what you get. The only reason I wrote this review is because the company emailed me several times requesting it, it is quite annoying to be honest. Overall, I would not purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Stay cool for a long time and I like the thin ...
customer_reviews.text: They work really well and I keep them in a cooler in my work Truck and I only need two of them most the time. Stay cool for a long time and I like the thin design saves room for your food. 5 stars in my book
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slim but don’t stay cold
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to put in my lunch bag which also transports my breast milk home at the end of the day. These just don’t stay very cold though, so I put them in the freezer at work then bring them back home. If you have to leave your cooler out all day with these in it, don’t expect it to be cool a few hours later. That said, they are very slim and easy to fit in a small bag but I have to use all 4 to make the bag cool enough so the size doesn’t matter anyway. Wouldn’t recommend unfortunately. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great qaulity product. I like how they use gel inside instead of water like cheap ice packs do. The gel doesn't expand when it freezes. So they stay flat which is nice. Their very qaulity built. But they don't stay cold long because their so thin. Roughly 1/2 thick. They work great as a additional or supplement ice pack. I use my big thick ice packs on sides and these thin ones on bottom and top and other 2 sides. Using these ice packs with my big ice packs with them. They stay cold for roughly 7 or 8 hrs. If I use just these thin ones only. They only stay cold roughly 4 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Customer Bobby

customer_reviews.title: They didn't really keep food cold. The packs were ...
customer_reviews.text: They didn't really keep food cold. The packs were barely cold after being in my lunch cooler for a couple of hours. I froze them for 48 hours straight before testing them out. I have a soft case lunch pack that I added closed cell, reflective padding to for additional insulation. The pack is already insulated but I put in additional 1/4 inch of material to the sides, top, and bottom. For my test I put all four cold packs into my lunch pack with 1 room temperature can of soda. About 4 hours later the can was barely cold and the ice packs were just 'cool' to the touch. Returned for refund
customer_reviews.author: v. nhan

customer_reviews.title: Keeps food very cool. Lasted about 5 hours in an open-top style ...
customer_reviews.text: Keeps food very cool. Lasted about 5 hours in an open-top style lunch bag. In a closed container it would probably last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: av

customer_reviews.title: For my needs they work great!
customer_reviews.text: I use a double section cooler bag to carry my cold drinks, my thermos for hot food and all my snacks and these cool packs do exactly what they're designed to do, just not as good as ice. They kept my drinks cool (not ice cold, but not bad either) for about 10 hours in 75-78 degree temperatures. They don't take up a lot of space, aren't particularly heavy and best of all, they don't melt and spill ice-cold water anywhere you try to set your cooler. They are perfect for my needs. They seem pretty well made, but I haven't had them long. I will update this review if there are any durability issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jerryf1

customer_reviews.title: worked great!
customer_reviews.text: I used these for a couple of day hikes. Kept water and snacks quite cool for about 8 hours in my insulated backpack. Probably would have remained cool enough for a few more hours if needed. Just popped them in the hotel refrigerator against the back cold plate overnight and they were frozen solid again ready for use. With the pack of 4, they are good for "surrounding" items ... putting one on the sides and top and front or back to your preference (I guess 5 or 6 would have been even better for even more surrounding, but 4 was quite effective). They are small enough and light enough to work quite well for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: TEK

customer_reviews.title: Nice and slim - great for lunch - As an FYI,  9 hours later no longer cold at all
customer_reviews.text: I pack these in my kiddo’s lunch. I like that they are slim and easy to insert. I only need them cold for about four hours and they work for this purpose so I’m happy. For the curious who need it cold longer, I can say only that nine hours later - when she’s back home - they are no longer cold at all. Many reviews indicate this timeline far sooner. For my purposes at four hours they work fine.
customer_reviews.author: CC✨👩🏻‍🍳✨

customer_reviews.title: Stays cold, well-constructed
customer_reviews.text: This product matches a pair of freezer packs I received with my lunch bag, and supplements them perfectly for a long-lasting chill that keeps my lunch safely cool for and entire day. Two of the packs side-by-side are exactly the internal size of my bag, so I place one layer at the bottom and another on top to "sandwich" the items I need to keep cool, and they keep the contents perfectly cool for 7 hours each day. The packs freeze quickly, create no mess, and appeared to be sealed well for a long life. I've just used these for a couple of weeks, but expect that they should hold up well for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Duane A. Priest

customer_reviews.title: They work great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kid's lunch boxes. They are just the right size. I have used them 5 days a week most of this school year and they work great. My kids say that their food is still cold at lunch time. The ice pack is still cool (not frozen) when they arrive home from school. None have leaked or broken, so I imagine they will continue to keep my kid's lunches cold for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a small lunch cooler, plan to use multiples (we suggest 3) each time, not just one.
customer_reviews.text: The ice packs work well. They are a nice size for keeping your cooler less bulky. They were still cold, though not frozen, at about 7/8 hours. Generally we only need them to keep cold for around 5 hours but I wanted to test them. I do suggest using multiples at one time to extend their cold time. We like three. Bottom, middle, and top of cooler. If you’re only using 1 or 2, I don’t think they’ll stay cool as long because they’re so thin. They really only cool the area that they touch. Works well for our needs!
customer_reviews.author: Cali

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids' lunch boxes
customer_reviews.text: Needed cool packs for the kids' lunch boxes. These aren't too heavy and fit nicely into the lid of the lunch boxes (ASIN B0725WW3VF). I never time how long they keep the contents cool but they appear to do the job and I'm not sure anything bigger would fit. I have also used them in a regular cooler for when I go shopping and it kept it nice and cool. The quality is good; I dropped them more than once, both frozen and unfrozen, and they survived without any issues. They have become an essential item in every day life and I can recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Sven Enterlein

customer_reviews.title: Fair price | Works | As expected
customer_reviews.text: Gist: They are thin and decently durable and get the job done. I ordered 2 sets of 8 on accident. It ended being okay because I use 3-4 packs in my single lunch box, but that's because I have a 5 meal lunch box. They freeze quickly and stay cold enough for my meal to be cold for a full 8 hour shift. I don't think they would be good for much longer than that though. My only current concern is that a couple of them seem to have expanded after refreezing, so I wonder what the long term durability will be like. So far I haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: SJxPyunKa

customer_reviews.title: So cool
customer_reviews.text: These suckers work GREAT! I actually bought 2-4 packs. I like that I can put them in and around my lunch pail, meaning, I can actually separate my food products with them and I believe it helps keep things cooler that way. For instance, I put 4 of them around my soda keeping my soda cooler than my sandwich, which has 2 on each side of it but it's in a container within my lunch pail if you can imagine that. I actually left them in my lunch pail overnight just yesterday and they were still cool the next morning. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AndyO

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money or effort
customer_reviews.text: When I unwrapped the plastic the gel had been leakimg inside. A lot of the gel was missing from inside the plastic holders. I'm returning it because Amazon will charge me if I do not. No option for replacement without returning it which is a pain in the ass since now I habe to drive to a UPS store which going out more tgan necessary was the reason for orderimg these on line. Also they are super thin. Too thin for a lomg day cooling if you will place this is a lunchbag.
customer_reviews.author: Nel Shops

customer_reviews.title: Keeps things cold!
customer_reviews.text: I got these to keep my daughters lunch cool during summer camp after hearing the lunches will be outside with them majority of the day. My daughter tells me that her lunch remains cold and even makes her sandwich a little colder like if she were just pulling it out of the fridge when she goes to eat it. This after being out in 90+ degree weather for several hours. She packs a snack in her lunch box too, to have even later in the day because its an extended hour camp and even that still cold when she goes to eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Keeping Refrigerated Items Cool in Transit
customer_reviews.text: So far, these have worked perfectly. We keep them in the freezer ready for use at a moments notice. We use them in conjunction with a soft side cooler to transport groceries to and from the RV, condo and grocery store. When we're going on a trip everything stays cool till the fridge is ready for use. I'm planning on buying a second set to have a few extras since one doesn't quite fill all six sides of the cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Charles J. Sarchet

customer_reviews.title: These are horrible. They only last for maybe a few hours
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible. They only last for maybe a few hours. I have a tiny lunch chest and using all four does not cool it.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff.R35

customer_reviews.title: Held freeze for 10 hours
customer_reviews.text: I flew from the midwest to Hawaii with an ice pack bag and 2 Freezer packs. Everything in the bag arrived cold after 10 hours. I stayed in Hawaii for 8 days and kept the ice packs in the freezer the entire time. Upon return, all of the snacks I brought onboard the airplane also stayed cold for the entire return flight. again, 10 hours +. I Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: J in KC

customer_reviews.title: Thin and useful!
customer_reviews.text: It comes in a 4 pack and they are surprisingly thin, but it works perfectly with my current lunchbox setup. Right now I pack a lunch for two in my RTIC 8 Can lunchbox, plus a drink, snack and two of these ice packs. Their thin size makes it easy to stick them on the sides of the main compartment; and so far they have kept my food nice and cold until lunch. Then snacks even stay cool until about the time I get home (0700-1730). Definitely recommend for personal lunchboxes or somebody who needs a versatile ice pack.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great supplement to larger ice packs
customer_reviews.text: I got these to supplement my Yeti ice pack in my Hopper 8 and they are perfect! They keep the sides cold without taking up valuable cooler space.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lunchboxes and long deliveries
customer_reviews.text: We use these not only in our sons lunchbox but also in our insulated delivery totes when we deliver microgreens twice a week. 8 of them perfectly line the bottom of our totes and keep the micros cool, but not too cold the whole delivery. Nice sturdy material that wont puncture or rupture causing a huge mess like some we have had before.
customer_reviews.author: Pensacola Micros

customer_reviews.title: idk what happened with those one star reviews.....
customer_reviews.text: I really don't know what happened with the one star reviewers' products. These are great ice packs! They're small, but stay cold all day. I didn't even realize how warm my lunch had been while using my old ice pack, until I switched to these. At 1:00 pm (I pack my lunch around 6:20 am), my soda was so cold that it felt like I was taking it out of a fridge. And it was a little unnerving how cold my soup was. Give these ice packs a go! I can't vouch for durability yet, but I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: These don't stay cold very long.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband's lunch box because we are tired of the cheap ones leaking and breaking. I thought these would last a long time, but they don't. You have to use all of them, which eliminates the benefit of them being light and small. They don't stay as cold as a block of ice would. However, they are durable and they do fit nicely in a lunch box. But, if they don't stay cold, what's the point? I estimate one of them lasts only about an hour or two.
customer_reviews.author: Write4Change

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: I use a Yumbox with the Yumbox sleeve and two of these fit perfectly inside the sleeve the keep everything cold. I have tried 3 different icepacks with my Yumbox and sleeve and these are the best! I also use them with another lunch bag I have and 2 of them do a great job of keeping my lunch nice and cold.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Really slim gives  more space for food!!
customer_reviews.text: I pack a lunch bag everyday and work outside so weather is a factor. Plus I need space in my bag for all my goodies. these are perfect. They’re really slim and I put a few in to keep everything cold especially in the new toke summers. I do find they don’t stay as long as I would like but again my lunch bag isn’t the best either. I ordered two sizes and love them both.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Caryl

customer_reviews.title: These are probably the best ice packs I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the best ice packs I've ever purchased. I put all 4 of these in my 12 can sized lunch box and not only was everything still cold after an 8 hour shift, these were still 75 percent frozen! And I don't have a refrigerator to store my lunch in. These are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: HurleyP.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for me
customer_reviews.text: Does not work for me! If you’re using all four and it only needs to last a couple of hours in a temperature controlled building... like packing a lunch for school or work, then these will most likely work for you. I work out of my car, 10-12 hours, going from home to home. I need something to keep all my food cold for 8+ hours in a car. Honestly, I’ve used a frozen water bottle that has remained frozen the whole shift.. I will likely go back to that method.
customer_reviews.author: Taryn Marais

customer_reviews.title: Great fit into lunch box
customer_reviews.text: I like the slim size because it doesn't take up a lot of room inside the lunchbox. It lasts through lunchtime and still feels cool later in the day. I'm not sure how it will last when the winter is over and extreme heat arrives. Because of how slim it is, I will try two ice packs during summer if one doesn't do the trick. Overall it is a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: DuchessofLanaster

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product for the price!!! With 8 off them in a pack I can keep them in rotation every 12 hours in my portable cooler. It keeps my worms alive for weeks just have to rotate them every 12 hours 4 packs every time and it will keep my cooler just the right temperature to keep my worms alive.
customer_reviews.author: Drake

customer_reviews.title: versital thin cold packs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size to put on the bottom and sides of my lunch box. Thin, but keeps food cold until lunch, no problem. My old ice pack was thick and heavy. it kept the food on bottom very cold, but did not cool the entire lunch carrier. These do a better job. Did not rate longevity or durability as I have not had them very long.
customer_reviews.author: Snapper

customer_reviews.title: Small.
customer_reviews.text: Thought these would be a little bit bigger than they actually are. With that aside, they will do perfect for small lunchboxes (old style kids tin would be best as that is about the size). And they seem quite durable, by the time its melted it should be ready to go right back in the freezer for another round.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Versatile product
customer_reviews.text: The ice packs have been phenomenal. I just had a total knee replacement and I have a blue polar cube that requires ice and water. Then the cold water is pumped through a pad that I put over my knee. I do not want to constantly buy bags of ice, so I thought that ice packs would be easier and more economical. And they are! Please seek your own medical advice if you choose to use your polar cube this way. I am not a doctor, but I find the ice packs very effective for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Stays cold, small but potent
customer_reviews.text: I use an uninsulated bag for to carry my lunch. No, they do not stay frozen all day, no ice pack will. They are small and do not take up a lot of room so it's easier to pack my bag. They keep my lunch cold long enough for me to have a cold lunch a few hours after I leave my home.. I use four of them... Durability I gave a five star although I haven't had them all that long, they haven't leaked yet and being as thin as they are it's easy to position them to not have to bear a load.
customer_reviews.author: CnS Computers

customer_reviews.title: great buy!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My husband sometimes leaves his lunchbox cooler in the bed of his truck while he is on a jobsite (contractor) and these keep things cool. That in itself is a feat considering we live in southwestern Florida where it's summer from March to November. I'd say these were worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: JEEP Chick

customer_reviews.title: Not for summer time!
customer_reviews.text: I read couple review before decided to buy this ice pack, they said good and long last for cold, but i think not for summer time, i put in the freeze them for 3 days before used, and only cool for few hours and melt..
customer_reviews.author: Yosia Darmawan

customer_reviews.title: Works great with our RTIC soft & hard coolers!!
customer_reviews.text: Freezes quickly & lasts the whole day (we have RTIC soft & hard cases). I put them in the freezer when I get home & pull them out when I leave the house for work. As long as you have a good cooler then you will love these. If you have a crappy-cheap cooler, invest in a good one & you will be happy. Don't blame the freezer pack if you have a crummy cooler
customer_reviews.author: Mason Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Keeps things really cold
customer_reviews.text: These are great! They keep things really cold. You have to be careful not to lay food directly on them or they will freeze them. This is great for liquids especially if you love cold beverages. They are a bit heavy and hard when they are frozen. It's best to place paper towels or towels around them to keep things from clanking around.
customer_reviews.author: Destiny DuShane

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and Freezes Quickly
customer_reviews.text: Pros: they fit in most any lunch box, very slim feature allows to stack along sides of lunch box, easily store in freezer without taking much space while waiting for them to freeze, and freezes quickly. Cons: not much, but the fact that they thaw relatively quick. I don’t have issues with it since I only use for a 4-5 hour period and it’s slightly thawed by the end. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Wont last long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the recent camping trip to yosemite and i got two packs of these to use it inside my cooler. It was not that great of quality to hold the freeze for long time. i used this inside coleman 50quart. My travel was for 4 hrs by the time i reached there most of these frozen boxes were liquid. and i totally hated seeing it.
customer_reviews.author: Guru

customer_reviews.title: Great, thin cold lunch ice pack or general cooling insert!
customer_reviews.text: I love my 8 very thin, ice cold, ice packs for my child’s lunch pale and my lunchbox! They are slim, under table, quick to freeze and stay cold for a long time! Easy to clean! Grab these today! Like my review, give me a thumbs up, cause you’ll love these frozen ice pack options!
customer_reviews.author: Eric S.

customer_reviews.title: Great ice pack, great value
customer_reviews.text: As sturdy as an ice pack can get, great value, put the whole pack in a 3x3 large cooler and it stayed cool for 12 hours straight, when I opened the cooler it was ice cold inside and only a little bit of ice melted. Mind you it sat in my trunk in 55-60 degree weather
customer_reviews.author: aab434

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: These arrived quickly and are as described. They are the perfect size to fit in my lunch bag. I recently used them on a trip. They (2 of them) stayed frozen enough to go through security at the airport. They were also still cold when I reached my destination. These are perfect for small lunch bag sized containers. You would need a lot more of them if using in an ice chest.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Husband Digs Them
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my husband, who recently switched to a job in which he has to bring lunch everyday and cannot store it in a fridge. He uses a thermal lunchbox to keep things cold all day, plus two of these. Works like a charm and keeps things cool for his full 12 hour shift. Perfection!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Rose

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my lunch cold!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these ice packs, because items were being stolen out of my lunch box when I used the fridge in the office break room. I decided to use ice packs to keep my food cold during the day so I can leave my lunch box on my desk during the day. I almost bought the Yeti ice packs, but these have better reviews and have been great so far. Definitely recommend for the quantity and price.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C.

customer_reviews.title: Busy mom says YES to these!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! They are slim, yet stay cold all day! I put them in my children’s lunch boxes every day, and no food poisoning from warm mayo yet! I also like that it comes in a package of 4. This means that when my kids inevitably forget to unpack their backpacks (every single day) that there is always a fresh ice packer ready to go when their mother is inevitably scrambling to get lunches ready to go at the last minute the next morning. Highly recommend. Has made my life easier, and that’s all I can hope for!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Stay cold for long periods of time
customer_reviews.text: Their thinness made me think that they wouldn't stay cold very long, but this was an item often bought with the rigid cooler I chose to buy (Coleman 30 Can Removable Liner Cooler - 3000002168). The combination of the two keeps my food and liquids cold for up to 10 hours while sitting in my car in 90 degree F temperatures. I have also used them with a cheaply made soft cooler. They lasted much longer with that container than I expected them to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ice packs!
customer_reviews.text: These stay cold for a very fair amount of time (well past when you would have lunch) especially when placed in an insulated lunch box. They are slim and don’t take up much room in lunchbox or freezer. Best ice packs I have ever used, perfect for smaller meals that you want to keep cold.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Boo

customer_reviews.title: Can keep a piece of gum cold.....nothing else
customer_reviews.text: If you need to keep a piece of gum cold these are good. If you need them to keep your good actually cold not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Broylz

customer_reviews.title: Too Expensive for what it is...
customer_reviews.text: I guess I should’ve looked at how big these things were before ordering but I thought paying $16 they would be pretty decent. They’re so thin. I should’ve just went to target and paid the same price for something better. I’m going to end up doing that anyways because these aren’t gonna cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsie Rou

customer_reviews.title: Good if you need something chilled for a short time.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: smaller size, making putting them in most containers easy. Thin: easy to find a place for them in a packed freezer. Cons: they don’t stay cold very long. I use these in my breast milk cooler bags when I pump at work. These lose their freeze within a few hours and after about 5 hours they’re only slightly cool. I’ve been using them only to keep my milk cool when transporting home. I put them in the freezer at work when I get there. Because of their short cool time I wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Marlise Webber

customer_reviews.title: These don't stay frozen more than a few hours
customer_reviews.text: I place these in an insulted lunch bag for work. The bag sits in an air conditioned office all day. By lunch time, the packs are still somewhat frozen. By days end, they aren't even cool. I regret this purchase. Perhaps their thin design just can't stay cold long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Slim & Functional
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to go into my breast pump bag to keep my milk cold at work. They work well. I very much like the slim design. It doesn't take up a lot of space in the bag which is great. My milk isn't extremely cold, but stays chilled until I get home to disperse into bottles. I'm pleased.
customer_reviews.author: JB-Prime

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly as advertised and are the perfect size for my lunch bag. Slim fit, but keeps frozen and everything cool for the day. I like cold sodas and water bottles and these ice packs are perfect. I usually use just one for the day, but sometimes I add a second to sandwich the drinks if I have a lot. These last forever. The only reason I had to buy more is because my wife keeps using and gives them away when she gives leftovers to friends/family after dinners. Highly recommend these packs.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Works great for school lunches
customer_reviews.text: I put one of these into my LunchBots bento box sleeve, along with the bento box itself, and it keeps the food nice and cold until lunch. They're durable, too. I had one accidentally fall out of the freezer onto the kitchen floor and it didn't break or damage at all. Highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Orvis

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: They melt easy and don’t keep my lunch box cold. By the time I was done filling my bag with these cheap ice packs just to keep the bag cool. I had room for one water bottle. Pay a little more for better product
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: These work really well!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical because of reviews saying these were horrible but since they are so cheap decided to try them anyway. My husband packed a room temperature drink between two of these and by his lunch (6 hours) his drink was ice cold! That's impressive. The slim profile is perfect for packing between things and on the sides. Buy these!
customer_reviews.author: juliaf

customer_reviews.title: Works better than a bag of ice cubes
customer_reviews.text: They are very convenient and compact. They only last a couple hours though. It might be my brand new lunch box, but I don’t think so. I still use them and as long as I don’t open up my lunch box for any reason they are cold for about 4 hours inside 70 degree office
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased these for my meal prep bag. The ones that came with the bag kept tearing on the corners and leaking after months of usage and decided to go with something more durable and better quality. These ice packs are very thin and keep the food in my bag cool for my entire shift at work (10 hrs). Definitely recommend these and would purchase them again if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Work good in a Yeti
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the Yeti cooler that’s always a little short on room. Worked perfect. They’re thin enough to wedge down the sides. And with 6 of them you can put some on the bottom down the sides and a couple on top. Keeps cold all day in a parked truck in Phoenix Az I like what we got !
customer_reviews.author: Golden

customer_reviews.title: Slim Icepacks
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to experiment with several slim ice packs vs my current, thicker, ice packs. I haven't used yet so can't judge if they will stay cold a reasonably long time(6-8 hours would be good). Star rating is irrelevant but you can't submit this review without adding starts. My guess: these will lose cold faster since their surface area per freeze volume is relatively high compared to my thicker ice packs (assuming identical fluid). IF so, it's still better than using ice cubes. And I can combine with my fatter ice packs if I plan on longer outings.
customer_reviews.author: JHW

customer_reviews.title: Beats the actual ice and no more wet lunch bags
customer_reviews.text: These are great, I pack my food and pace them under/over or around my food. This keep my food cool even on hot days without the hassle of ice and wet lunch bag. These also keep my drinks cool and I definitely recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Ghost Zero

customer_reviews.title: Slim & Easy
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something particularly slim & light, knowing that would mean I would get reduced amount of time frozen. These worked really well in my cooler a full day at the beach in the sun & exceeded my expectations. That being said, they are still slim & don't last as long as "traditional" ice packs.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Functional ice packs
customer_reviews.text: These ice packs do stay cold 4+ hours depending on what type of lunch box, cooler, etc they are in. They fit in the bottom of most lunch bags. I have experience no leakage or issues. They appear to be more durable than ice packs I have used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Keeps cool
customer_reviews.text: These really keep their cool. I have bought other ice packs that have just not been so great. These have outdone any other ice pack that I've had. They stay frozen while others defrost. They are also durable and the perfect size for my husbands lunch box and daughters bottle cooler. I liked this product so much that I bought a second set. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Reyna Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Didn't stay cold long
customer_reviews.text: The ice packs do not stay cold. I put all four in my small yeti and it was getting warm by lunch time.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Work Great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a soft sided lunch box I use. I needed a thinner size than the one provided. They fit great and last the majority of the day. If it were a regular cooler I'm sure they would last all day if not longer.
customer_reviews.author: Genes

customer_reviews.title: This product does not stay cold for 4 hours
customer_reviews.text: short term is good ... but lunch from 6-12 i would not recommend to stay as cold as you like ...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Great Ice Packs
customer_reviews.text: I have used these over and over and taken them on so many trips. They stay frozen all day and I also love how they are so thin so they don't take up much room, but they do work just as well as those big bulky ice packs. I actually gave the ones I have to my daughter and I just bought me some more! We definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G.

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: Ice packs works okay. Had them in a soft pack cooler in my hot car all day during work and they managed to say a bit cold by the end of the day but mostly melted. Personally I think they are too thin to keep themselves frozen. Will be going back to my old thick freezer packs. May work better when the cooler doesn't have to stay in a hot, confined area.
customer_reviews.author: vucyvubhcubibg hvucycuvivycyvu

customer_reviews.title: Leaked upon first use, but excellent service from Healthy Packers
customer_reviews.text: These are a great size for a small lunch cooler, and they stay surprisingly cold for a long time. However, one of them leaked the FIRST time I used it! The seller, Healthy Packers, has provided outstanding service, sending a replacement right away!
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Keeps food cold!
customer_reviews.text: I use them for shopping since I m not close to any stores. On my last trip to Costco, food was in my coolers for several hours, & the blocks were still frozen when I returned home.
customer_reviews.author: Joan w.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the hubbs from complaining
customer_reviews.text: I think they're great! I put two in my husband's lunch box every day to keep his sandwich and water cold. As the weather gets hotter I may add the 3rd and 4th one because he works outside. He's not complaining so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Berger

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Freezes quickly and holds cold temperatures! I used two of these and 4 cans of soda in a cooler box. Stayed cold for 5 hours at the beach and Was still cold when I came home! I loved how thin and Efficient these ice packs where.
customer_reviews.author: samantha sullo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lunch boxes
customer_reviews.text: These slim ice packs are perfect for my kids lunch boxes. I love that they are slim and easily fit in the pocket of their lunch boxes. They also do a great job keeping their lunches cool but not taking up too much space. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tiremomma12

customer_reviews.title: Coldness decreases within 8 hours
customer_reviews.text: These are small enough to fit in small spaces I have in my lunch box, yet they dont seem to last the full 8 hours of my work day. Give it things arnt completely hot in my bag by the end of the day but they arnt as cold as pulling them out of a fridge.
customer_reviews.author: John-Michael

customer_reviews.title: Nice cool packs for trips
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a long bus trip I was taking to west Virginia and Tennessee. We mad stop overs for Motels and the bus was highly air conditioned. So with all those factors the food was kept cool, and so was the cool pack. I like the slim design that fit well into our insulated cooler bag and kept our food fresh and cool.
customer_reviews.author: Candee k.

customer_reviews.title: Not as long lasting as I expected
customer_reviews.text: When I received these in the mail I at first thought they were way too small. After keeping and using them the size is ok, but i tend to use as least two if not three at a time. They do keep the lunchbox cold, just not as cold as I would like. These are ok for now, but I will continue to look for a better option.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Thin, yes. But keeps food cold.
customer_reviews.text: 1 pack on its own may not be enough to keep your lunch cold. But two of them in a proper lunch container should keep it below room temperature. Three of them will definitely keep it cold like your fridge. These are super thin but it's good to lie on your lunch container with or your small cooler. Three of these thin packs can keep your lunch cold for at least four and a half hours. I eat yogurt with no concerns.
customer_reviews.author: T&M

customer_reviews.title: Convenient Little Packs but Not Meant for Coolers
customer_reviews.text: These are very slim and freeze quickly, I assume they would be perfect for a lunch box. I tried to purchase these to save space in my cooler however they did not last very long, at all. The weather was very warm and the packs just did not hold up. We had three other types of cold packs in there that stayed frozen almost the entire time but these slim ones probably lost their coldness after maybe 4 hours. So food for thought, I would combo these with other bigger ice packs if you want them for the cooler otherwise stick them in the lunch box.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda di Grazia

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love how slim they are and they stay cold for a long time. Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: mzmedic

customer_reviews.title: Good for semi-cold items
customer_reviews.text: These keep items cold, but not super cold, and not all day as I had hoped. I use them in my (old fashioned Coleman) cooler to transport frozen raw dogfood home from the store, but wish they kept things frozen.
customer_reviews.author: P Moore

customer_reviews.title: Stay Cold
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use for kids lunches at summer camp. They seem to stay cold in their Coleman backpack style cooler. I will pack lunches at 7:30am and they are still cool at 5pm when we get home. Enough so that i don't worry packing yogurts and things that could spoil for afternoon snacks.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Horrible ... now I have to buy others
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my Rubbermaid cooler 8x12x12. All 4 do not keep my food cool for even 8 hours. I asked and all the responses said they are HORRIBLE!
customer_reviews.author: DeAnn Soults

customer_reviews.title: They fit in tight spaces and stay cold for a long time
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a trip we were taking and needed to keep a large cooler cold. They worked perfectly. They fit into small places that large packs cannot. They are thin so I worried that they wouldn’t stay cold but they Lasted for our 7 hour car ride
customer_reviews.author: Birdnerd

customer_reviews.text: We like this product, but not love. The reason being is that my husband has 12 hour shifts so he stores his breakfast, lunch, and dinner in his lunch pack with these. He says that by lunch they’ve already thawed a bit, but by dinner they’ve thawed and his dinner is almost like warm.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Handy thin-size cooler packs
customer_reviews.text: Used these several times in an ebag to carry and keeps food cold; great for beach; day at the ball game; Light weight ... stays cold. Fits perfectly in my TSA approved size carry on cooler!
customer_reviews.author: CarrieK

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars bc you need two in order for the Ice Packs to Stay Frozen from 8am - 5:30pm
customer_reviews.text: I use two of these ice packs in my 1 year old daughters lunch pack for daycare. When I only used one, the pack would be luke warm when the lunch bag came home. Since I pack milk in her lunches and sometimes the milk comes back half full, I now pack two cool packs. Product works well. I would give 5 stars if I only needed one in her lunches. Product works well in a Built NY neoprene lunch bag with a shoulder strap.
customer_reviews.author: Ami

customer_reviews.title: The good and the bad
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter's lunch bag as she'll be at a daycamp this summer and lunches can't be refrigerated. We tested them out on a potluck party we attended and there are pros and cons. Pro - they freeze quickly. They're slim in profile so they don't take up a lot of real estate in lunch boxes. They also don't take much room in your freezer. Con - they get SWEATY!! Like REALLY sweaty. I'm glad we took them for a test spin because now I know to place them inside a sealed zip-top bag as I'm packing lunches.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Witty

customer_reviews.title: Great way to keep lunch cold
customer_reviews.text: I use these for keeping my lunch cold. Used to use a small container with frozen water. It was always melted by the time I got back home. With these, I use a couple of them in my lunch container, and they're still quite cold when I get home from work.
customer_reviews.author: sadatoni

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stay cold.
customer_reviews.text: These don’t stay cold. They didn’t keep anything in my cooler bag cool. I’m throwing them away. I was also asked for review by the company and when I had a complaint about this and another product I got no response. The customer service is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: JZK

customer_reviews.title: these cool packs are terrific
customer_reviews.text: these cool packs are terrific; i have a small freezer and the slim packs do not take up much space. i use this for grocery shopping when i have several stops to make. the individual packs are great to place around the items to be kept cold. great product at a great price; what more could you ask for.
customer_reviews.author: sun angel

customer_reviews.title: Last over 3 hours after removing from freezer
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I noticed it was still frozen for at least over 3 hours after removing it from the freezer. I wish it was more flexible, but overall no complaints. Seller sent my products on time.
customer_reviews.author: Euphoria

customer_reviews.title: Great Find!
customer_reviews.text: So far so Good, love the slim pack---we use this in my sons cooler to keep him milk cool during outings. I haven't timed it but it seems to do the job and gives us more functional room in the cooler!
customer_reviews.author: Lorena

product_meta.title: Ice Pack for Lunch Box - Freezer Packs - Original Cool Pack | Slim & Long-Lasting Ice Packs for your Lunch or Cooler Bag (Set of 4)
feature_bullets: SLIM LIGHTWEIGHT AND LONG LASTING - Set of 4 slim, reusable and versatile hard gel ice packs. Each ice pack measures 7 x 4.7 x 0.5 inches. Keep your insulated cooler bag freezer-cold for longer!

SUPER VERSATILE - Perfect chillers for everyday use in lunchboxes, breastmilk bags, bento boxes and coolers. Great for kids to take to school in their totes, adults to the office or for outdoor camping. Keep your to go food containers cold and dry.

SAFE AND DURABLE - Our Cool Packs are made with 100% BPA-Free Non-Toxic materials. They stay cool as ice for many hours and keep your food fresh and your body fit. These small babies sure pack a punch!
QUALITY GUARANTEED -Try the best ice packs available risk-free. You won't regret it. Not fully satisfied? Shoot us an email and we'll fully refund you no questions asked.
TSA DISCLAIMER: Healthy Packers Long lasting Cool packs can be brought through TSA security checkpoints when fully frozen or otherwise stored in checked baggage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,142 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
